result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley S Ford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All court costs and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison account under SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashley S Ford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: GUILTY PLEAN & SENTENCING Original Transcript (20 pages) commencing JULY 14, 2014 received and filed.cg
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.

Defendant Ashley S Ford in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Ashley S Ford in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 12.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to THIRD DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.225(3), a Class G felony.
To the charged offense: 
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense, defendant and Lovie C.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 215 days time served, concurrent with revocation sentence in 10CF852.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DV surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Defendant to register as a sex offended for 15 years.
-Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with victim, TTC dob 10-30-2000.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.  Defense counsel is to file Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Acknowledgment.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing.  Br 12 has several sentencings today.  Defense is in trial in Br 38.  Br 38 agreed to hear this matter for Br 12.  Parties notified.

Attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz contacted by the court.  Defendant Ashley S Ford not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams for the State of Wisconsin was also contacted by the court.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Br 12 is in trial and not able to hear this matter.  Clerk notified the parties.  Court ordered the matter adjourned.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-14-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ashley S Ford incustody, not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz in court.  Defendant Ashley S Ford in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Defendant was not produced from the prison system.  State will have the defendant produced for the next court date.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-26-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz in court, defendant Ashley S Ford not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for status hearing.  Br 12 has the co-defendant's matter schedule for jury trial.  State request this matter be reassigned to Br 12.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Further proceedings scheduled for 05-07-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz in court, defendant Ashley S Ford not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Co-actor, Lamar Cone 13CF5445,  has case pending in Branch 12.  State is requesting that this case be re-tabbed to that court.
Case is adjourned to 4-3-2014.
At request of defense counsel, Jeff Schwarz, due to calendar conflict, scheduling conference is changed to 4-2-2014 at 8:15am.  ADA Jennifer Williams is advised of date change.

Defendant Ashley S Ford in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Defendant Ashley S Ford in custody.  Step Nolten for Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.C.C. (10/30/2000) OR HER RESIDENCE/FAMILY/SCHOOL/WORKPLACE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW) INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ashley S Ford in court with attorney Dawn Rablin.  Defendant Ashley S Ford in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
